org.fcrepo.utilities.xml

Interface XPathSelector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    XPathSelectorImpl

    public interface XPathSelector
    Interface for doing efficient XPath selections. To obtain an implementation of this interface use DOM.createXPathSelector(String[]).

    Note that your DOM must be constructed with namespaces explicitly enabled for a namespace aware selector to work properly. You do this either via the DOM.streamToDOM(java.io.InputStream , boolean) or DOM.stringToDOM(String, boolean) methods or by calling setNamespaceAware(true) on your DocumentBuilderFactory.

      Extract a boolean value from node or return false if there is no boolean value at xpath

      Double selectDouble(Node node, String xpath)
      Extract a double precision floating point value from node or return null if it is not found

      Extract the given value from the node as a String or if the value cannot be extracted, the empty string is returned

    • Method Detail

      • selectInteger

        Integer selectInteger(Node node,
                    String xpath,
                    Integer defaultValue)
        Extract an integer value from node or return defaultValue if it is not found.
        Parameters:
        node - the node with the wanted attribute.
        xpath - the XPath to extract.
        defaultValue - the default value.
        Returns:
        the value of the path, if existing, else defaultValue

        xpath - the XPath to extract.

      • selectBoolean

        Boolean selectBoolean(Node node,
                    String xpath)
        Extract a boolean value from node or return false if there is no boolean value at xpath
        Parameters:
        node - the node with the wanted attribute.
        xpath - the path to extract.
        Returns:
        the value of the path, if existing, else false

      • selectString

        String selectString(Node node,
                  String xpath,
                  String defaultValue)
        Extract the given value from the node as a String or if the value cannot be extracted, defaultValue is returned.

        Example: To get the value of the attribute "foo" in the node, specify "@foo" as the path.

        Note: This method does not handle namespaces explicitely.

        Parameters:
        node - the node with the wanted attribute
        xpath - the XPath to extract.
        defaultValue - the default value
        Returns:
        the value of the path, if existing, else defaultValue

      • selectString

        String selectString(Node node,
                  String xpath)
        Extract the given value from the node as a String or if the value cannot be extracted, the empty string is returned

        Example: To get the value of the attribute "foo" in the node, specify "@foo" as the path.

        Note: This method does not handle namespaces explicitely.

        Parameters:
        node - the node with the wanted attribute
        xpath - the XPath to extract
        Returns:
        the value of the path, if existing, else the empty string

      • selectNodeList

        NodeList selectNodeList(Node node,
                      String xpath)
        Select the Node list with the given XPath.

        Note: This is a convenience method that logs exceptions instead of throwing them.

        Parameters:
        node - the root document.
        xpath - the xpath for the Node list.
        Returns:
        the NodeList requested or an empty NodeList if unattainable

      • selectNode

        Node selectNode(Node dom,
              String xpath)
        Select the Node with the given XPath.

        Note: This is a convenience method that logs exceptions instead of throwing them.

        Parameters:
        dom - the root document.
        xpath - the xpath for the node.
        Returns:
        the Node or null if unattainable.
